DataElement.preferredName: Person Monoclonal Antibody VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Discontinue Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was discontinuation of monoclonal antibody therapy, therapy using an antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells that are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous, or vascular endothelial growth factor receptor inhibition therapy, therapy that blocks an enzyme needed to form blood vessels, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Monoclonal Antibody VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Discontinue Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the discontinuation of monoclonal antibody therapy, therapy using an antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells that are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous, or vascular endothelial growth factor receptor inhibition therapy, therapy that blocks an enzyme needed to form blood vessels, as an element of a personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Monoclonal Antibody VEGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor Discontinued Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous population of hybrid cells i.e., hybridoma; hybrid cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis and treatment.:A substance that blocks an enzyme needed to form blood vessels.:Discontinued; stopped permanently or temporarily.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: An antibody produced by a clone or genetically homogenous fast-growing cells i.e., hybridoma. Hybridoma cells are cloned to establish cell lines producing a specific antibody that is chemically and immunologically homogeneous. They are widely used in cancer detection, diagnosis, and treatment.
Any substance that inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptor, a family of tyrosine kinase receptors involved in the formation of blood vessels.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have all chimeric or human or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have all chimeric or human or humanized monoclonal antibodies (including Bevacizumab) or VEGF receptor fusion proteins (including VEGF Trap/aflibercept) been discontinued for at least 12 weeks prior to today?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will all chimeric or human or humanized monoclonal antibodies (including Bevacizumab) or VEGF receptor fusion proteins (including VEGF Trap/aflibercept) been discontinued for at least 12 weeks prior to start of study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient completed prior therapy with monoclonal antibody(ies) at least 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient completed prior therapy with monoclonal antibody(ies) at least 28 days prior to Step 2 registration?
